intro: Ctenitis leucostipes, commonly known as the white-stemmed tree fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and feathery fronds. The plant has a distinctive white, fibrous sheath covering its trunk, which gives it its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. The fronds are compound, with pinnae that are typically narrow and linear in shape.
